SEARCH
Package com.example.dangle_lotto

Class FirebaseManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.dangle_lotto.FirebaseManager
public class FirebaseManager extends Object
FirebaseManager — handles all Firebase-related operations for authentication, users, and events.

This class serves as a data manager for Firestore and Firebase Authentication, handling creation, retrieval, update, and deletion (CRUD) operations for both users and events. It also manages bidirectional relationships between users and events via subcollections.

Since:
2025-11-01

    • signIn

      public void signIn(String email, String password, FirebaseCallback<String> callback)
      Signing in a user with email and password. Send uid to callback function if successful.
      Parameters:
      email - Email of the user
      password - Password of the user
      callback - Callback function to call when user is created

    • signUp

      public void signUp(String email, String password, String name, String phone, String photo_id, boolean canOrganize, FirebaseCallback<String> callback)
      Create new user in the database and instantiates a user object with all required attributes.

      Pass null into phone and photo_id if user has decided not to provide that information.

      Parameters:
      email - Email of the user
      password - Password of the user
      name - Name of the user
      phone - Phone number of the user - set null if not provided
      photo_id - Photo id for user profile picture - set null if not provided
      canOrganize - Boolean value indicating whether the user can organize events
      callback - Callback function to call when user is created

    • createNewUser

      public GeneralUser createNewUser(String uid, String name, String email, String phone, String pid, boolean canOrganize)
      Creates and stores a new user document in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      uid - Firebase Auth user ID.
      name - User name.
      email - User email.
      phone - User phone number (nullable).
      pid - Profile photo ID (nullable).
      canOrganize - Whether the user can organize events.
      Returns:
      Instantiated GeneralUser object.

    • updateUser

      public void updateUser(User user)
      Updates an existing user’s data in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      user - User object containing updated fields.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String uid)
      Deletes a user and all related data from Firestore. Removes references from all events and subcollections the user participated in or organized.
      Parameters:
      uid - User ID to delete.

    • getUser

      public void getUser(String uid, FirebaseCallback<GeneralUser> callback)
      Retrieves a GeneralUser by UID from Firestore.
      Parameters:
      uid - User ID.
      callback - Callback that receives the retrieved user object.

    • createEvent

      public Event createEvent(String oid, String name, com.google.firebase.Timestamp datetime, String location, String description, int eventSize, int maxEntrants, String pid, ArrayList<String> categories)
      Creates and uploads a new event document to Firestore.
      Parameters:
      oid - Organizer ID.
      name - Event name.
      datetime - Event timestamp.
      location - Event location.
      description - Event description.
      eventSize - Event size limit.
      maxEntrants - Maximum number of registrants.
      pid - Event photo ID.
      categories - List of event categories.
      Returns:
      Instantiated Event object.

    • updateEvent

      public void updateEvent(Event event)
      Updates event data in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      event - The event object containing updated values.

    • deleteEvent

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteEvent(String eid)
      Deletes an event from the database. Recursively goes through all users the event has been registered for and also deletes all of those references. Waits for the asynchronous calls to complete before deleting the event at the end.
      Parameters:
      eid - string of user id to search for and retrieve all attributes

    • documentToEvent

      public Event documentToEvent(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot doc)
      Converts a Firestore document snapshot into an Event object.
      Parameters:
      doc - The Firestore document snapshot.
      Returns:
      An instantiated Event object.

    • getEvent

      public void getEvent(String eid, FirebaseCallback<Event> callback)
      Retrieves an event from the database and instantiates an object for it.
      Parameters:
      eid - string of user id to search for and retrieve all attributes
      callback - callback function to call when event is retrieved

    • getUserSubcollection

      public void getUserSubcollection(String uid, String subcollection, FirebaseCallback<ArrayList<String>> callback)
      Retrieves a subcollection of an event from the database. Calls the provided callback function when event has been received. Usage: getUserSubcollection(uid, "collection name", new FirebaseCallback<ArrayList<String>>() { 
      
      @Override
      public void onSuccess(ArrayList<String> result) {
          // define what to do with result
      }

      @Override
       public void onFailure(Exception e) {
                 // define what to do on failure case
             }
         );
  }
      Parameters:
      uid - string of user id to search for and retrieve all attributes
      subcollection - string of subcollection to retrieve
      callback - callback function to call when event is retrieved

    • getEventSubcollection

      public void getEventSubcollection(String eid, String subcollection, FirebaseCallback<ArrayList<String>> callback)
      Retrieves a subcollection of an event from the database. Calls the provided callback function when event has been received. 
      
 Usage: getEventSubcollection(eid, "collection name", new FirebaseCallback&lt;ArrayList&lt;String&gt;&gt;() {
      @Override
      public void onSuccess(ArrayList<String> result) {
          // define what to do with result
      }

      @Override
       public void onFailure(Exception e) {
                 // define what to do on failure case
             }
         });
      Parameters:
      eid - string of user id to search for and retrieve all attributes
      subcollection - string of subcollection to retrieve
      callback - callback function to call when event is retrieved

    • userAddStatus

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> userAddStatus(String uid, String eid, String subcollection)
      Adds a user to the requested list for an event in the database.
      Parameters:
      uid - User id
      eid - Event id
      subcollection - string of subcollection to retrieve

    • userRemoveStatus

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> userRemoveStatus(String uid, String eid, String subcollection)
      Removes a user from the requested list for an event in the database.
      Parameters:
      uid - User object containing all required attributes
      eid - Event object containing all required attributes
      subcollection - string of subcollection to retrieve

    • getEventsQuery

      public void getEventsQuery(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot lastVisible, int numEvents, FirebaseCallback<ArrayList<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot>> callback)
      Retrieve a list of events from the database.
      Parameters:
      lastVisible - last visible event
      numEvents - number of events to retrieve
      callback - callback function to call when event is retrieved

    • getOrganizedEventsQuery

      public void getOrganizedEventsQuery(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot lastVisible, String uid, int numEvents, FirebaseCallback<ArrayList<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot>> callback)
      Retrieve a list of events from the database.
      Parameters:
      lastVisible - last visible event
      numEvents - number of events to retrieve
      callback - callback function to call when event is retrieved
